com.abmash.api.browser

Class WaitFor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.abmash.api.browser.WaitFor

  • public class WaitFor
extends java.lang.Object
    Waits for the browser, used by calling Browser.waitFor().

    Sometimes it is necessary to wait for the web page, which needs to complete loading page elements. This is usually the case when JavaScript gets executed, mostly AJAX calls. Wait conditions can be customized by specifying own JavaScript code.

    Author:
    Alper Ortac

    • Constructor Detail

      • WaitFor

        public WaitFor(Browser browser)
        Constructs new BrowserWait instance to be able to define wait conditions.

        The default timeout length is 20 seconds.

        Parameters:
        browser - Browser instance to work with

      • WaitFor

        public WaitFor(Browser browser,
       int timeout)
        Constructs new BrowserWait instance to be able to define wait conditions.
        Parameters:
        browser - Browser instance to work with
        timeout - wait for this amount of seconds until a timeout exception is thrown

    • Method Detail

      • query

        public void query(Query query)
           throws java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        Waits until element is found. Useful for waiting for an AJAX call to complete.
        Parameters:
        query - the element query
        Throws:
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException

      • element

        public void element(java.lang.String query)
             throws java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        Waits until element is found. Useful for waiting for an AJAX call to complete.
        Parameters:
        query - the element which needs to be found, identified by the visible text or attribute values
        Throws:
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException

      • elementText

        public void elementText(HtmlElement element,
               java.lang.String text)
                 throws java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        Waits until element contains the specified text. Useful for waiting for an AJAX call to complete.
        Parameters:
        element - the element to observe
        text - when the element contains this text the execution of the program will be continued
        Throws:
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException

      • elementText

        public void elementText(java.lang.String query,
               java.lang.String text)
                 throws java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        Waits until element contains the specified text. Useful for waiting for an AJAX call to complete.
        Parameters:
        query - the found element should contain the text or attribute value specified here
        text - when the element contains this text the execution of the program will be continued
        Throws:
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException

      • evaluatedJavaScriptExpression

        public void evaluatedJavaScriptExpression(java.lang.String expression,
                                 int timeout)
                                   throws java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        Waits until the specified JavaScript returns a non-false value.
        Parameters:
        expression - the JavaScript expression to evaluate
        timeout - time in seconds to wait until a TimeoutException is thrown
        Throws:
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
